Event.name: Attempt_means
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen> using some <fen>Means</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">John</fex> <t>tried</t> <fex name="Means">using a crowbar</fex> <fex name="Goal">to open the door</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">They</fex> <t>tried</t> <fex name="Means">opening the window</fex> <fex name="Goal">in order to rob the store</fex>.</ex>
Very frequently, an entity involved in a <fen>Means</fen> action stands in for the <fen>Means</fen>, and similarly a <fen>Goal</fen> may be metonymically expressed with an entity related to a <fen>Goal</fen> situation:
<ex><fex name="Agent">John</fex> <t>tried</t> <fex name="Means">a crowbar</fex> <fex name="Goal">on the door</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">They</fex> <t>tried</t> <fex name="Means">the window</fex> <fex name="Goal">in order to rob the store</fex>.</ex>
Unlike the Attempt frame, the <fen>Means</fen> is focused upon, and the <fen>Goal</fen> is often implicit. This frame answers the question of how something is to be attempted, rather than what is being attempted. The frames can be most reliably distinguished by paraphrasing a sentence with "give X a try", since "give try" belongs only in this frame.</def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agent">Dana</fex> <t>tried</t> a crowbar.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
<ex>John <t>tried</t> using a crowbar <fex name="Goal">to enter the locked door</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Outcome
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Note: this FE might not be in frame. It is temporarily here during the early stage of annotation. (JGK)
The <fen>Outcome</fen> is the failure or success of an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex>He <t>tried</t> the back door <fex name="Outcome">but it was firmly bolted</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an attempt occurs.
<ex>Dana <t>tried</t> <fex name="Means">using a crowbar</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which an attempt occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Depictive</fen> is a phrase which describes the <fen>Agent</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The place where an attempt is made.
<ex><fex name="Place">On the bridge</fex> he <t>tried</t> the crowbar.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes the attempt.
<ex>He <fex name="man">quietly</fex> <t>tried</t> the crowbar.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time peiod over which the attempts take place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The reason for which the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts the <fen>Goal</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is independent of the the attempt of the <fen>Agent</fen> to achieve the <fen>Goal</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Domain
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Note: this FE might not be in frame. It is temporarily here during the early stage of annotation. (JGK)
The area of work to which the Attempt event belongs.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes the number of times an event is attempted per some unit of time.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: try.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make an attempt using some means

lexUnit.name: give try.idio
lexUnit.definition: FN: attempt to use (something) for some (usually unmentioned) purpose. [Usage: try must be indefinite, but may be singular or plural; give is not passivizable.]
